results.title: Festival in Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: Douglas Clarke, Howard Thomas and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Scenes from the 1954 Edinburgh Festival of music and drama, including a short sequence showing Margot Fonteyn and Michael Somes dancing ‘The Firebird’, Ann Todd and Paul Rogers in a scene from Macbeth, Sir Adrian Boult conducting the National Youth Orchestra and before the castle.

results.title: Festival 78
results.creator_credit: Christopher Wade, Gil Cardinal and Access Alberta
results.brief_description: Festival 78 was the first cultural festival in Commonwealth history, and was held in conjunction with the XI Commonwealth Games in Edmonton, 1978. As an exchange of culture from all countries there was emphasis on national dancing, and many performances of all kinds took place throughout the city of Edmonton. Written and narrated by Dave Billington.

results.title: Fertilization and birth
results.creator_credit: Curtis Avery and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to describe for young children the reproductive processes from fertilization to birth in fish, birds, animals, and humans. Includes birth sequences of puppies and farm animals. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Fences
results.brief_description: Early colonial settlers ran sheep on huge unenclosed areas of grazing lands, but when gold was discovered shepherds left the sheep-runs and flocked to the gold-fields. Sheep were “enclosed” and later fences were erected as protection against rabbits and wild dogs.

results.title: Feminine Fashions in India
results.creator_credit: Dilip Jamdar, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Presents the colorful costumes worn by women of India as their daily dress. The sari is the most commonly worn style, others shown include the Rajasthani ghagra, bodice and odhani, salvar kamiz and dupatta of Punjab and garara of Uttar Pradesh.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dilip Jamdar, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Feminine fashions
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The costumes of Indian women and the accessories that go with them. The sari, the most popular dress, and also the pheran of Kashmiri women, the colorful dresses of the Khasi and Naga women of Assam, the salwar and kameez of the Punjab and the gharara and odhuni worn by the young women from Uttar Pradesh.
results.creator_credit_for_label: K Khandpur, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: The Fell locomotive
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Roy Harris and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A description of a new locomotive being produced in England. This is the first completely diesel engine to be evolved and an entirely new method of transmitting power to the wheels is incorporated in it. The film illustrates the advantages it has over steam, electric and diesel electric locomotives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter De Normanville, Roy Harris and Shell Film Unit

results.title: Feiz, the last expert
results.creator_credit: Milan Chupurdija, Ceda Oketich and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: This film portrays a man and his son in Belgrade, Yugoslavia, who scratch out a living by travelling the streets in search of pots and pans to repair. The occupation of “tinker” is the focus of this film, one which is seen as diminishing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milan Chupurdija, Ceda Oketich and Perspective Films

results.title: Feelings of depression
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How and why feelings of depression carry over from childhood to overshadow adulthood are explained in the case of John Murray, an industrious and conscientious businessman. As his case history unfolds we see how persisting reactions to early emotional problems render him incapable of enjoying a happy, normal life. (Award: Toronto)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
